text: a British grandfather and three times
cancer survivor Cole Andrey now
languishing in a Saudi jail his family
say he's threatened with the public
flogging the Saudis deny it he was
pulled over by psyd police in August
last year on a street in Jeddah caught
with bottles of bootleg wine and his car
alcohol is strictly forbidden in Saudi
Arabia and he got a 12 month prison
sentence should have been released in
august yet he hasn't been released and
we just don't seem to have any idea when
he's going to be released if you'll get
the lashings and quite funny if he does
get a lashing we fear for his health and
safety David Cameron seen here on on an
earlier visit has been pressured into
intervening or mr. Andrews behalf
separately Britain has today pulled out
of a 6 million pound contract to advise
the Saudis on their prisons a contract
the Prime Minister had earlier defended
it's right that we do work with Saudi
Arabia but we wouldn't ever be any part
of the punishment that they carry out
with sandy area Michael Gove the Justice
Minister was known to be opposed to the
prison contracts you on the grounds of
Saudi Arabia's much criticized human
rights record and we have now reviewed
this issue further and decided to
withdraw arpit Saudi Arabia is Britain's
biggest trading partner in the Middle
East it's not just arms contracts like
the sale of typhoon jet its oil services
and jobs for 25,000 expatriates anyone
going out to work there is warned what
not to do the rules are absolutely clear
when you go into the country and when
you live there you do not get involved
with alcohol and if you do you risk the
most severe penalties so frankly I don't
have much sympathy with this gentleman
and I think if the British government
are reacting in any way to this they're
mistaken but for Karl Andrey the wheels
of justice are turning impossibly slowly
he is now 14 months into his 12 month
prison sentence Frank gartner BBC News
